intro: Nesaea salicifolia, commonly known as the willow-leaf nesaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, willow-like leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is often found in moist, woodland habitats and thrives in partial to full shade. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
